entries.title: 80 Years After D-Day, France Examines the Trauma of Allied Bombings
entries.description: Macron commemorates the more than 50,000 French civilians killed in U.S. and British air raids during World War II.

entries.title: Cheaper Ozempic Alternatives Are Out There. Be Wary of Fakes and Fraudsters.
entries.description: The high price of weight-loss drugs has people looking for other options.

entries.title: To Find Winning Stocks, Investors Often Focus on the Laggards. They Shouldn't.
entries.description: These stocks are getting hit for a reason. Instead, focus on stocks that show ‘relative strength.’ Here’s how.

entries.title: The Aging U.S. Power Grid Is About to Get a Jolt
entries.description: Bracing for a surge in demand for electricity driven by power-hungry EVs and AI data centers, utilities adopt new tech to help boost transmission capacity.

entries.title: SpaceX Aims for Better Landings in Latest Starship Test
entries.description: The Elon Musk-led company is developing the rocket for future missions, including NASA’s first astronaut trip to the moon in decades.

entries.title: Stock Futures Little Changed After ECB Cuts Interest Rates for First Time Since 2019
entries.description: S&P 500 futures wavered and global markets broadly gained after the European Central Bank’s quarter-point rate cut.

entries.title: European Stocks Pare Gains and Euro Rises
entries.description: European stocks pared gains and the euro strengthened after the European Central Bank cut interest rates for the first time since 2019, but signaled it was still concerned about inflation.

entries.title: ECB Cuts Interest Rates for First Time Since 2019
entries.description: The quarter-point rate cut potentially puts the ECB and the Fed on different tracks and widens an existing gap in borrowing costs between the U.S. and Europe.

entries.title: The Wing Founder Audrey Gelman Is Opening a Hotel
entries.description: After leaving the Wing in 2020, Gelman opened a small homewares shop in Brooklyn. Now she’s expanding the country-chic brand into hospitality, starting with an 11-room inn in the Hudson Valley.

entries.title: Euro Rises After ECB Cuts Rates, Stresses Future Decisions Will Depend on Data
entries.description: The euro rose against the dollar after the ECB cut interest rates by 25 basis points, as widely expected, but said risks to inflation remained and that future decisions would depend on upcoming data.

entries.title: Today's Logistics Report: China's Standalone Supply Chain; Lawmakers Targeting Forced Labor
Sporting-Goods Companies Warm Up for Busy Summer
entries.description: Sportswear companies moved to clear out leftover inventory to make room for new product lineups ahead of a summer packed with major sporting events, but analysts say any sales benefit will likely take time.

entries.title: NIO Loss Widens on Lower EV Sales but Expects Stronger Second Quarter
entries.description: The Chinese EV maker ’s net loss widened in the first quarter, with electric-vehicle sales off to a seasonally slow start.

entries.title: Chanel Creative Director to Leave in Latest Fashion Shake Up
entries.description: Virginie Viard is set to leave the luxury brand, marking the departure of one of the few women to lead the artistic direction of a major fashion house.

entries.title: He Perished on Everest. His Last Letter Recounts the Harrowing Journey.
entries.description: A decade of correspondence offers an intimate glimpse into the life of mountaineer George Mallory.

entries.title: These Parents Are Shelling Out to Have Someone Else Pack Their Kids for Camp
entries.description: At elite sleep-away camps, some costing upward of $15,000, the pressure is on for parents to send junior off with all the right gear

entries.title: Want to Pay Cash? That'll Cost You Extra
entries.description: From ballpark hot dogs to parking tickets, more cash payments are coming with a fee.

entries.title: Israel Strikes U.N. School-Turned-Shelter in Gaza, Says Hamas Was Operating There
entries.description: Palestinian officials said dozens of displaced people were killed at the facility in central Gaza.

entries.title: Basic Materials Roundup: Market Talk
entries.description: The latest Market Talks covering Basic Materials.

entries.title: Energy & Utilities Roundup: Market Talk
entries.description: Centrica, Fortum and more in the latest Market Talks covering Energy and Utilities.
